document.docAuthor: Mauffray, William F. & Tennessen, Kenneth J.
document.masterDocTitle: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Catalogue and Historical Study of the Odonata of Ecuador

bibRefCitation.author: Calvert, P. P.
bibRefCitation.refString: Calvert, P. P. (1948) Odonata (Dragonflies) of Kartabo, Bartica District, British Guiana. Zoologica, 33 (2), 47 - 87.

subSubSection.paragraph: A species-rich genus in the Neotropics, although only three species have been found in Ecuador ( Fig.76 ). The major reference for identification is Belle (1988a). The nymphs live in slow portions of small to mid-sized streams where silt and sand have accumulated.

caption.paragraph: FIGURE 76. Phyllocycla anduzei ♂, PERU, Junin Dept., river near Tzancuvatziari, E of Satipo, 23 xi 2015, photo K. J. Ten- nessen.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Phyllocycla anduzei (Needham, 1943)
. Publ. Recs. ECU: * Dunkle (1981) , (H06), (P11), (H14); NA : Tennessen (1996b) ; PA : Belle (1988a) . Also BOL, COL, PER, VEN, TTO: (H06), (P11).
